intro: Myrsine jelskii, commonly known as the New Zealand myrsine, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to New Zealand and is typically found in coastal and lowland forest habitats. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by dark blue berries. Myrsine jelskii is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
